column3: Trope detail
Character concept: like Tealc. Plays it really flat. Does not show facial reactions. Does not understand cultural references e.g. "What is an Oprah?"

column2: NPC concept: sad sack like Eeyore. But knowledgeable about something.

column3: A +1 sword with an inscription that says Stabitha

Lost temple of Bahamut (God of Order and good dragons). It is located high in the mountains where the dragons would be able to fly in and land. But evil dragons have taken it over - needs to be cleared of the dragon(s). Perhaps some dragonborn/kobold servants. Dargonborn cult who believe themselves destined to inherit dragons powers.
Discover a reference to a lost ruined temple of Bahamut. It is far away. But was supposedly once an outpost temple. May contain records of how the religion was structured and secrets of Bahamut power. How Bahamut dispensed justice. Paladins as Travelling judges
The good dragons were put into a slumber.  Perhaps because they are part of the Riftborn power.  Without the active Riftborn power they fall asleep into statues.  Do the pcs encounter statues of good dragons.  PCs discover one and wake it up
There are stories of supposedly good dragons that once lad armies of men against evil.  Dwanhaven even has a supposed dragon protector but they have not been seen in written history.  It is now just a story and most don’t believe it.  The dragons were banished back to their realm when the Riftborn died.  With the return of the Riftborn blood line and power the dragons hear the call and wake up or return.

Dawnhaven’s story of a protector dragon comes from a supposed statue of one in the middle squat of the city
Find reference to a lost city of the forerunners. It was purposefully hidden and removed all written references to it.  Has some forerunner tech. ZPM/arcane battery
NPC ascends instead of dying. But can’t act because of rules. The others made the rules (ancients). Some of the forerunners learnt to ascend. But they practice non interference

column2: Want to help people so much it tears you up when you can’t.

column3: The chosen bloodline are physiologically advanced enough to access Riftborn magic. Uses a part of the brain not normally used

column2: Have NPCs refer to old wars that happened 500 yrs ago to make the world seem old. Also talk about famous ruins, or wonders of the world (dams, bridges, the floating islands, the great gates that were said to pass across the world - only one still works somehow (it has a zpm powering it).)

column3:
A super soldier of the devoted, clad in special armor from the Riftborn (they have discovered how to master their technologies plus magi tech from Azathoth). Traditional attacks (decide which type) do not touch it. Need a special kind of weapon to get through the armor. And it is going after the wardens of the void. Removing opposition to the devoted so that nobody will be able to stop them bringing Azathoth through to Taeleran.
The super soldiers of the devoted recruit from disaffected Tiefling youths. Then enhance them so you won’t recognize them. They never see their families again. They are called the Lost Boys among Tiefling communities.
Explosive arrows (do 1d6 fire damage on a hit, with a 1 in 10 chance to set the target on fire (taking further 1d4 fire damage each turn until put out by rolling as an action then prone).
High elves are haughty like the Tok’ra in Stargate SG1

column2: A lost library of the Forerunners
column3: A library of knowledge. A repository of the ancients.the greatest repository of knowledge in the known universe.
Someone like Senator Kinsey from Stargate SG1. Trying to get control of the power of the Forerunners and trying to control the direction of research and exploration (and missions) to do so
The devoted originally fought amongst themselves. They still do. Can’t trust each other
What is Llolth up to in the world? What evil agenda is she directing the drow to pursue?  Do the PCs need to get the aid of the drow?

column2: There’s an enchanted forest: The magical spirits of the enchanted forest. A wrong demands to be righted
column3: Forest that is sparsely planted with lots of space between the trees.  But the canopy is joined as each tree is a gigantic tree.  Trunks are super thick and canopy spreads to intertwine with others
When life throws a curve ball, just do the next right thing.  Like Anna does in Frozen 2

The Devoted are going around eliminating people from bloodlines of The Chosen.  Made to look like accidents and natural causes, but not.  Example:  Mother and father of a PC were lost at sea, but by conspiracy
The rivers source is Magic’s source.. a magical river said to hold all the answers about rh past

There is another power. It is a spirit, of the chosen. A bridge between the power of the Riftborn and all of sentient sapient life, that will bring balance to the force
A great magical power/artifact was once a person.  They selflessly sacrificed themselves for the greater good and so a god decided to transform them into a sentient power instead of dying. They continue to protect the community that they sacrificed themselves, but only if the community stays true to their original values.  Discord and strife may weaken the sentient power.
Power of prophecy and seeing potential futures. Need to go on eldritch mental journeys traversing the psychic multiverse to discover the future.  A very rare power among the Riftborn
https://www.instagram.com/reel/DK2NEKyIvAD/?igsh=MWMzN3hyeHM2dmF5bw==

column2: Good dragons came from somewhere else
column3: Good dragons came from another dimension - from Dragonlance. But meeting the Riftborn, they decided to join them and come through to Taeleran

A place protected like with a null field from Foundation. But you fall asleep and wake up somewhere else
A null field.  Is it in a person or an object.   But previously cast spells are not affected, only new ones.  Possible to get a ring to be immune.
Approaching a tower you start to feel headaches which get worse and worse with every step as you get closer.  If you continue take 1d6 psychic damage for every 15ft you travel.  Turns out there is a null field emanating from the tower.  Those with Riftborn blood are not affected.  Who put it there?  Why can some people be not affected?  Inside the tower is lost knowledge of the Riftborn.
Item: armour that resists a certain type of damage eg fire.
Soul burn: take a future mark of a death saving throw fail in exchange for health regain. Need restoration spell to remove the death save fail or just long rest?

column2: Feywild travel is not as it seems
column3: In the Feywild, going west takes twice as long as going east. Going north feels exciting while going south feels wrong.
Echoes in the void. Echoes as a power? They come back to you. The resonate. Can be used to see (echolocation/radar).

Areas that are not rifts but where the reality is thinner. Where there might be leakages. Enough to make pendulums swing and psychics get headaches, to give a house a reputation for being haunted.
Need to wait for the sun to rise on a particular day of the year for the suns rays to strike a special receptacle.  When this happens the wards are weakened on the rifts.  And need a special reflector to make it work.  When this all works able to access a special rift space dimension.  Otherwise locked away from all magic.
Ancient stargates between continetnts, planets, or entire galaxies
Svalbard as northern valleys of Taeleran
Delegation of the elves talking about departing this plane forever and returning to the Fey
An NPC who is a golem. Only communicates by writing on a slate that it wears around its head. Has a master. Must work.  Very strong
Alchemists are known for blowing up their laboratories in experiments. Looking to turn lead into gold, create a fountain of youth potion etc. create stronger dynamite. Dynamite tester
Monster with blue blood that glows in the dark

Mind attack: takes you to the plane of blood where it is an endless flat expanse of blood. Your body begins to take shape made of blood, running up from the floor. The monster stabs you in the eye. You go blind. Take 20 psychic damage.
Puddles on the floor. Droplets begin to flow up
A bridge over a river is in the shape of a huge sword being held horizontally by a kneeling hooded figure
Warlock patron offers you everything you wanted but you have to kill one of the party
A place filled with Mannequin-like statues that all appear to be looking at you, silently. Who made them?

A legend that at Halloween/Samhain,  the changeling fairies come through portals at the base of hawthorn trees, to drag people away to the fey and take their place. Villagers light bonfires to keep them at bay and dress up like fey creatures to confuse the changeline fairies (this is the root of Halloween dress up culture)

Molarmo/uber tooth fairy: if you have a hair or piece of someone (likes tooth) you can use a special type of magic to control them somewhat. So collecting teeth, then keeping them until the children grew up, means you can control whole population, subtly influencing how they think.  Molarmo is the boss of the tooth fairy and sometimes asks Holy to help collect kids teeth
Magic wardrobe: you go in and come out the back in another world, like in Narnia

The purple robes believe by serving Azathoth they will be saved and will be born again by Azathoth as radiant beings of pure energy with access to the raw power of creation.  Even Azathoth's destruction of the material plane will not matter because they will be free to start a new reality with the promised power.
A mineral that cancels out magic and magical power (like dimeritium in The Witcher)

Magic item: gloves of gnome throwing: advantage on athletics checks to throw a gnome. Ranged attack (Dex mod + proficiency). Thrown gnome does 2d6 bludgeoning damage and the gnome gets an attack of opportunity on the throwers turn.
Magnum PI as an NPC. Seriously sexy moustache. Gets all the ladies without even trying. Has a really beautiful cart.

A great cliff edged plateau - everything below is shrouded in perpetual cloud layer, and no one knows what lies beneath. Nobody who has ventured down has ever returned. There is a way down via a mine. Civilisation -land order is on the top (amongst the light of the sun), wilderness and unknown chaos lies below. The closer one gets to the edge, the closer one gets to chaos, with settlements less and less civilized - more of a Wild West out on the edge. Some airship ports extend out into the air, with some foolhardy adventurers going out via airship and airship lift (special airships that have a descent pod they lower down for adventurers)

A site of human sacrifices from a barbarian tribe. A great pit of bones at the bottom of a cliff, where sacrifices are thrown off the cliff alive. Their screams are interpreted to foresee the future. A cult of orcas unearths the skeletons below to raise as undead soldiers for Orcus.

The High Elves long ago went on a crusade to remove the men from the earth. But their numbers were few compared to the fast breeding humans and each death cost them much. Eventually a new wave of thinking prevailed among the high elves, one of inner contemplation and pacifism.

column2: Ruined and defaced shrines to gods of order and goodness.

column3: A guy who keeps a monster zoo. Loves the monsters
A great canyon with huge waterfalls. Two rivers join above and flow into the canyon (like Victoria Falls/Iguazu Falls)

healing potions are made from a dodgy source, involving slave labour. It actually extracts life an vitality from a person somewhere and is concentrated down and mixed with other sources, into a concentrate. The concentrate is shipped around the world and sellers mix it with water and flavours - this is why its not always the same amount of heal per bottle. Maybe there is a “sustainable” source?

Forerunner locations:  Giant monolithic towers, hundreds of meters wide. Hollow inside. Like the tower of the inquisitors from Obi Wan
An obelisk holds ancient Riftborn secrets

Fairy Magic is tied to emotion. The stronger you feel something in the emotion tied to your magic, the stronger your magic the happiness magic = healing, destructive magic = anger
Embracing emotions makes you stronger not weaker
a system in which magical power is essentially determined by emotional stability and focus. If a magic user can control their emotions, their magic becomes more focused and more powerful. If they cannot, their magic will remain ineffective and can be dangerously unstable.
A farmer has disappeared. Has been taken into the “other world” ie the fey. Something in The Fey loves the thrill of the hunt, and feeds off the fear it creates. This fuels its magic.
A changeling is where a fairy baby is switched with a human baby at birth. A fairy child is brought up mundane

column2: Myth:  the year the sun didnt rise
column3: There is a story that once the sun set and did not return for a full year. In this time the world was reshaped in a period of massive geographic violent upheaval, society crashed and many died. When the sun came back the world was changed. The survivors emerged from hiding and rebuilt as best they could. That was 10000 years ago
A vampire with a blood addiction. Loves the bite. But recognises it drives ppl away and makes him lonely. So is attending AA or BA (Biters Anomymous). Includes werewolves etc
An NPC who can’t afford his debt.  Someone is coming to collect on the debt, and they will collect in a magical, cruel way unless the heroes can help

Escape from NY: one of the stones of power is said to be located in an ancient city that nobody goes in because nobody comes out. Used as a jail for people infected with something terrible. Will you get infected?
A temple to a forgotten forest god made of trees grown into a temple shape
Adventurers are seen as sleazy opportunists

Time exists in a loop. When this universe ends, a new one will be birthed from its ashes. This has already happened an infinite number of times before, and it will happen an infinite number of times again.  Azathoth is the mechanism for the end each time, so that the new may begin

This universe is just one of an infinite number within a vast multiverse. Not only are you an insignificant spec on a rock hurtling through space, you aren’t even a unique spec, as there are an infinite number of you across the multiverse.

In the spaces between spaces there are ethereal beings who watch all of reality, with no piece of knowledge hidden from them. They are watching you. They always have been. They always will be.  Nobody who knows of them knows what their intentions are towards us
A great rent in the earth like the Grand Canyon.  Ruins of a great city that was once on top but was torn asunder when the earth was ripped apart and the canyon created

The gods are tied to the world of Taeleran.  On other worlds other gods hold domain (these gods are related, like cousins).  So the gods needed something to stop Azathoth from consuming the world (and them).  So they “helped” the Riftborn to discover the ability to create and manage rifts in space time and to travel through them to other dimensions and worlds.

column2: Where did the good dragons go?
column3:
Dragons:  when the devoted killed the Riftborn there was some popular support.  The metallic dragons were disgusted by the actions of the humanoid races and chose to go into deep hibernation, turning to stone.  The world generally believes there are no such thing as good dragons, and good dragons are but a myth or a kids story.  But there is one silver dragon left called The Watcher, who is watching and waiting for a time when the humanoid races have matured enough to realize the error of their ways, and for a time when the world will need the aid of the metallic dragons.  The Watcher will roar a wake up call to call the metallic dragons back to life, breaking free of their stone slumber to come to the aid of the world.  But only the worthy can ask The Watcher to do this.

The dragons went into hibernation because of the prophecy that one day the riftborn would return via the chosen (although the part via the chosen is not clear to those who read the prophecy, it just claims that the riftborn will return one day, after many ages have passed).

The good dragons were put into a slumber.  Perhaps because they are part of the Riftborn power.  Without the active Riftborn power they fall asleep into statues.  Do the pcs encounter statues of good dragons.  PCs discover one and wake it up
There are stories of supposedly good dragons that once lad armies of men against evil.  Dwanhaven even has a supposed dragon protector but they have not been seen in written history.  It is now just a story and most don’t believe it.  The dragons were banished back to their realm when the Riftborn died.  With the return of the Riftborn blood line and power the dragons hear the call and wake up or return.

Dawnhaven’s story of a protector dragon comes from a statue of one in the middle squat of the city.  This is in fact a hibernating dragon.

There is an archipelago called The Pirate Isles.  it is occupied by a loose confederacy of pirates, and is deemed too unsafe for non-pirates to visit.  It is commonly considered to be a den of debauchery and iniquity.  One of the stones of power is hidden in the pirate isles and has been secretly protected by the pirates for thousands of years. This is why they started to be pirates, to keep the seas clear around the hidden stone so nobody would discover it

The final place to fit the stones of power together is in Waterdeep.  The horde of the devoted is descending on Waterdeep to destroy the city and its inhabitants, but the steward of Waterdeep is too proud to ask Dawnhaven for help.  But there was once a great alliance between Waterdeep and Dawnhaven, as both are the inheritors of the squires of the Riftborn.  A great signaling system stretches across the land between the two and is maintained but nobody believes will ever be used.  The PCs need to sneak into Waterdeep and secretly activate the signal fires to request the aid of the powerful military of Dawnhaven.   All the while, it is a race against time to get the stones of power to Waterdeep for the alignment ritual before the hordes of evil arrive.  Need to hold off the evil while the ritual is completed to seal off Taeleran from the far realm and azathoth.

A god emperor but the empire has declined.  Used to rule across a great land but encroaching desert has cut the empire back to a city state.  But has a fanatical guard of paladins who believe in the god emperor’s divinity.
A mad dictator seeks to rebuild a lost empire.  All that is left is a single city state (ruled by this dictator) but it once ruled vast swathes of territory.  But everyone has forgotten that this empire was evil.  The dictator Believes in nobility of it (like Putin) - returning to former glory.
A vampire state.  Run by vampires, they cloak the sky with artificial clouds.  Barovia?

Airships are for the lost part controlled by a monopoly.  Never sold, fiercely control the IP, so that nobody else may build their own. Used as safe fast travel - for a hefty fee.  Any crashed airships are sought out to discover their secrets, but are held as guild property and the guild will seek them out to retrieve or destroy so that knowledge is protected.

But some Pirates also have airships.  How they do smuggling.  They are secret airships.
A sacred funeral procession.  Moving slowly.  Playing deep ethereal chanting.  Perhaps an elven funeral.  Everyone feels it in their body.  Taking the body to be burnt and returned to the earth.
A fortress that floats in the sky.  Perhaps it can move, only able to be accessed from the air.  It may be occupied or abandoned for many years.

Some lost art of making certain type of weapons - like Valyrian steel.  What does Dan’s sword look like?  Is it secretly one of these with a hidden power?  Rune steel.  Panabi's sword is made of Runesteel

A religious crusade or witch hunt aka Christianity and the Catholic Church, but the Purple Robes having insinuated themselves into a major religion and now using it to turn the population against the PCs.  Spanish Inquisition.

Dragon priests who believe dragons hold lost knowledge that will lead us into a golden age if only they would share.  But in fact the good dragons have all gone into exile.  Only evil dragons are left.  They have a prophecy of those who will call the dragons to our side.  Many of these dragon cults are evil, focusing on allying with evil dragons to borrow their power and lord it over others.  There are handful however of those who pine for the return of the good dragons
Ghostbusters in fantasy world.  Have a cart pulled by horses, proton packs(?) and ghost traps?  Busting makes them feel good.  Lots of ghosts and other undead.  Are they a paladin order?
In a fantasy setting
Sterotypical biker bar but fantasy style.  Bikes all parked out the front, plays hard rock
Dream herbs that allow you to synchronize dreams with others.  Creates a new world of wthatevet you can imagine.  Communicate over long instances in dreams

Memory traders. Alchemists have discovered a way to extract memories from someone’s mind, and the rich Hve developed a taste for tasting rich experiences- victory in battle, a beautiful sunset, making love with your wife even.  And the poor are selling their memories for food.  But this leaves them as husks, unable to remember what is importsnt to them, great gaps in their brains.
Skystone.  An ore that defies gravity so it can be used as a base for floating platforms

Waking plague.  Afflicted eyes turn milky white and they can’t sleep.  Not dreaming or sleeping pushes awareness to new heights, seeing patterns in snowflakes and air currents, solving generations old problems of maths and engineering.  But not sleeping or dreaming comes at a cost - lose humanity, slowly turning into intelligent undead as the body withers away and do not perceive others as human, just as cattle and beneath you.  Initially normal humanoids want to get the power of the waking plague, but then start to fear it as they see the afflicted die or undertake terrible experiments.  Kind of like becoming a lich.  A lich plague?

The devoted are not truly immortal.  They have been granted the magic powers to clone themselves young and transfer their consciousness into their cloned body.  So if one of them ever dies, they just wake up in a new body.  This makes them functionally immortal, like The Comte de St Germain.  The location of the cloning facility is ultra top secret and is hidden within a continual storm in the sky.
There are stories of people who reappear throughout history. Like they have different names but the same faces and personalities.  Are they time travelers,  or immortals?
A dread god created the Necronomicon and tried to get magic users to use the book and trade away their souls.
Can implant special dragon crystals in your body to collect more power. But this creates necrotic damage or risk of it

column2: How the devoted were hooked by Azathoth
column3: The Devoted were hooked by Azathoth, but remade completely by it into absolutely devoted slaves to its will:  There was a moment when the clearing filled with dancing devils all glowing with their inner wickedness. They fought for the privilege of mounting Whisper. There was a time when Whisper faced the eye. A time when, I think, Whisper died and was resurrected, died and was resurrected, till she became intimate with death. There were times when she was tortured. And another time with the eye. The fragments I retain suggest that she was shattered, slain, revived, and reassembled as a devoted slave. I recall her pledge of fealty to the Lady. Her voice dripped a craven eagerness to please.
Monsters come from alternate dimensions. They originally came through to Taeleran from another dimension

The Temple of Time, where there is a great rift in the time stream.  Location of the time stone.  Houses a special rift not between dimensions but between timelines.  Can shift backwards and forwards along a timeline and also across timelines.  Can control this rift but very difficult to create new rifts (until attuning to the stone and creating a special magical device - like a tempad).

The ravings of those close to death/in the moment of dying are actually the voice of the void or of an otherworldly patron.  There is a cult that slowly kills orphans to record the messages in the hope of revealing great power or foresight.  They set up and run orphanages but in the basements they run death clinics.
Some of the stars are the god-favored heroes and beasts that did something worthy of legend and now they rest in the sky forever more
An old god needs help getting acolytes.  needs you to recruit believers.  For from worship and belief they get power
Astral dimension - a place where the soul exists outside of the body.  Use to spy on other people (through objects - like tellaranrhiod)

Someone has stolen the forbidden texts long hidden and now risks completing a dangerous forbidden ritual that would risk the entire world.  Opens a hell dimension in exchange for power.  
No knowledge is forbidden, only reserved for those powerful enough to control them.

Harness energy drawn from other dimensions of the e multiverse to make spells magic weapons, arcane batteries etc Like how ZPMs in stargate harness energy from subspace for almost limitless energy
However there is in fact a limit
You cannot beat a river into submission.  You need to surrender to its current and let it take you where it will.

The Riftborn relics/sanctums protect the material plane from the dark dimension.  If they fall the dark dimension will flow forth.
The Riftborn held back the demons of the rift.  Many of the wards were damaged when the Riftborn died.  Once they were gone the demons started to come through.  Demons now terrorize the world. Worlds End is a village that faces a continuous stream of demons from the rift outside the village.  An endless war centered around the village.
The wards are weakening.  Seven seals protecting the world from threats from other dimensions.  Before the Riftborn this world was constantly attacked by beings from other dimensions.  No stability.  Lots of fear.  The Riftborn put these wards in place, ushering in a world of safety and stability.  Now the wards are weakening.
A vast network of underground tunnels and caverns, carved by the faithful over thousands of years.
Secret markings and messages/prophecies that are only visible when someone with the blood of the Faun.  Looks like a dead end/plain wall until it lights up

A celestial seeks to govern the routes people take.  Her name is Gaiaen Proneas Sindarin - GPS (or that is the acronym).  People revel for the freedom to choose their routes.  Lady of the Map.  People can send a prayer to her for guidance and she will send you a map of the shortest safest route.  But now she is starting to send them to people who don’t ask.  And if you don’t follow her route she gets upset. And can appear as an angry hag.  She gets power from people sending the prayers and doing what she says.

Wild encounter - a drive through fast food but medieval. A “ride thru”. Run by chaotic good goblins.  Eating the food grants a benefit - the effect of a long rest, but gives terrible flatulence.  No refunds.  They are based in a White Castle.

Character backstory - their father or mother was saved by a mysterious spirit long ago when everyone else was wiped out.  Then it can become that the character themselves has the opportunity to reach back through time and save their parent.  They find a rift that is not a rift in space but in time.  Time rift.  Can reach back to exert impact on past events and people.  But hard to know where you will end up.

A few people start to hear a siren call.  But most don’t.  Turns out they all have a special power and the siren call is from the source of the power calling them to come and claim it.  Calling them into the unknown

Concept of “the old gods”.  People have moved on with their worship and our ideas of gods have evolved.  Long forgotten but something remains.  Good, or evil? Or more neutral? Just a force, for neither good or evil.
Crypto mission - crypt mining for magic items.  Requires lots of “power”
Meet a fantasy Conspiracy nut.
Murder hobo mission. Like a destruction room. Must eliminate the infected to stop a virus sweeping through a village. Enforce the quarantine! But who is actually infected?

A cavern with chaotic goblins running a clandestine psychedelic mushroom harvesting operation.  The goblins do not welcome intruders and naturally think others are trying to muscle in on their funghi harvesting scheme.
A plain, unadorned black obelisk. If brought above ground and into the open, the obelisk will draw down a near-constant barrage of lightning to itself – even if the sky is clear.

The remnants of a massive door of stone which has been smashed into rubble. A magic mouth which had once adorned the door remains intact. As the PCs draw near it will issue its warning: “Disturb not this chamber, lest the world suffer.” Whatever the mouth was set to guard is gone – the chamber beyond the broken door is empty.  This had contained a shard of Azathoth's power, stolen by the Riftborn.  But now it is released, likely by the Purple Robes and the devoted.

The silver hilt of a sword with a grip of black leather. The blade is missing, or never existed to begin with. One night per year, however, on the eve of the new year, the hilt is possessed of a ghostly blade – allowing it to perform its duties as a sword once more.

An astrologer’s chart, inscribed with the finest instruments and the greatest precision upon a vellum which is both supple and expensive. Close inspection by those with the proper knowledge, however, reveals that these charts were constructed around an entirely different night sky – and, possibly, a calendrical system and length of year unlike anything known upon this world.
A charm of twisted black obsidian. Touching the charm unleashes strange, ghostly visions from a strange and alien world – utterly different in every particular, but eerily similar to our own world in its broad scope and form.

On a wind blasted plain, discover the foundations of what would have been a mighty wall just poking up between the grass.  Stretches for miles across and you stand at what appears to have been an opening in the wall.  What did it protect?  Why has it gone? Touching the wall grants a silent vision of it standing complete as a group of strange soldiers rush through the gate into a shimmering portal.  See the soldiers emerge from a similar portal in what looks like the main square of Neverwinter. A state of emergency.
A small, leather-bound book filled with prophecies. All of them will be found to be true, but the last of them is dated just a few weeks ago.

A sword of truly mammoth proportions. Resting within a chamber more than thirty meters long, the sword stretches from one end to the other. Whatever creature was meant to wield this mighty weapon would truly stagger the imagination of a dragon.
Poison drips – steadily and continuously – from the tip of a stalagmite which stands alone within a natural cavern deep beneath the surface of the earth.

Within a wooden box carved with pastoral scenes lies a leather purse, and within the purse are a handful of seeds. If these seeds are planted, they will take root and grow into plants of unnatural shape, hue, and life unlike anything seen upon this world, and operating by utterly alien principles.

A tablet of pure gold, inscribed with the core rites and beliefs of a venerable religion. Careful study of this tablet, however, will reveal subtle – but important – differences between these ancient practices and the current practices of the religion in question.

A cache of ancient coins left from the elder days of the world and made by a civilization utterly alien to the values of today: They are carved from bloodstone, moonstone, and jacinth – with unknown faces and unreadable runes decorating their surface.
A set of 7 ancient age worn ivory figurines, each of which bears an uncanny resemblance to each of The Devoted. Each has an icon engraved.  One shows the icon of a crane.

“Show yourself” style “coming into your power” experience as PCs activate their ancestral powers
PCs need to speak the words of radiance to step into their power.  They discover the words through adversity.  Different words for each of rhem and for each subclass.

A critical spell book that was lost turns out to be a copy, copied from spells carved into a cursed/sacred mountain top millennia ago.  Where did the carvings originate?
PCs need a magic spell book.  BBEG destroys it.  Turns out it was copied from an inscription high on a mountain cliff face.  Travel there to discover a lost monastery

A secret village hideout:  amongst some low hills there is a canyon you cannot see from outside those hills.  A subterranean river runs through the canyon below, and a village is carved into the face of the canyon.

Shardstone magic.  Shardscience. Magic ores created by the rifts - found near rift sites as the magic “bleeds” out into our reality.  Can hold and transport rift magic like a battery. Commonly called Darminite
Someone who is out of their tree.  Mutter incoherently or in a constant pattern.  Turns out their muttering are the secret the PCs need.  And they were sent insane to discredit them.

Contact with an active rift curses one of the PCs with “maddening knowledge”.  Roll 1d6 to determine cursed effect:
1. I suffer horrible night terrors that drive me almost mad, but sometimes these night terrors impart useful knowledge
2. I slew a follower of a deep old one and ever since then I have heard their whisper in my mind.
3. My mind is linked with the mind of a mad astronomer with otherworldly lore. 
4. A cosmic entity has taken an interest in me and helps me with knowledge at a price 
5. I found a forbidden copy of the necronomicon and its words and symbols are burned into my brain
6. Azeroth marked my family hundreds of years ago and we have been cursed with visions ever since.
* Eyes of a mad scholar: I can read and understand any language.
* Madman’s wisdom:  you gain proficiency in wisdom and insight.
* Deep whispers: if you roll a 1 on a d20 attack, saving throw or ability check, the madness becomes too much to bear.  Roll 1d6 to determine the effect:
1. The voices become louder until the practically scream in your head.  You are incapacitated until the next turn.
2. You are temporarily max with rage for the next 2 turns - attack the closest creature.
3. Eldritch incantations stream foryh from you and you cast shatter at 2nd level focused on your position.
4. A creature you can see grows monstrous and distorted.  You are frightened for 1 turn.
5. Eldritch energy bursts forth from you and you summon a Pentadrone in an area you can see within 50ft of you
6. The visions prove beneficial, you may add your insight modifier to your next roll.
Hidden within a dungeon is a goblin nightclub.  Does stand up comedy, goblin style, and has rooms upstairs for one on one entertainment.
An old wizard knows a lot about religions and languages.  he is looking for a successor
Increases your movement to 60 ft, by jumping you 15 feet in the air.  As the boots lift you into the air they wail and laugh crazily.
A magical gate that teleports anyone who enters to the place they need to be most.  From the gate, distorted echoes of monster sounds can be heard
The Devoted run a franchise system where they recruit start up cults to do their bidding for them. Then dispose of them.
Meet at a hellmouth battling demons

Can't remember where his weed farm is, somewhere hidden out in the forest.  Who can help him?  NPC analogue:  Shaggy from Scooby Doo.
Discover a hidden valley with fields of weed.  There is a small village full of gnomes (or goblins) who farm the weed and have a network of drug dealers.

A spear once owner by a yound woman who gave up making money as a bard and instead went into the world of monster hunting.  A critical hit with this spear allows you to attempt to hit the creature again, one more time.  If the second attack succeeds, the target is poisoned
Sandy desert- encounter a great purple worm.  Tracks your vibrations.   Need to either fly or walk out of pattern. Or stick to the rock

Find a puzzle box next to a skeleton. Unlock it by sticking your finger inside it.  It “bites” you.  Then nothing.  Over days undead are attracted to you.  It builds and builds until waves of them follow you to attack you and carry you away.  Run you into a crack in the earth exposing a dungeon underground.  Takes you to an ancient crypt where there is an altar.  They mention “he has the blood”.  Try to sacrifice you to turn you in order to use your blood to revivify their undead god.  But loads of loot to have.  If you party can save you in time.  Based on Hellraiser movie.  Start to slowly let your blood.  Your party must track you (follow the undead, hard to miss) and fight their way in through hordes of undead.  Treasure to be found.  And mention of the blood of the chosen has special properties, imbued with the power of the old ones (ie the faun)

“The Mother” like Mother Nature.  But has great anger to any who threaten nature.  Key focus is on balance - maintaining the natural balance.  What if she was subverted and her idea of balance was overwritten - so she viewed balance as wiping out humanoid civilisation (except for elves)
In a far away kingdom, with very different practices, PCs get forced to fight in a gladiatorial arena.  Crowd have mad bloodlust

Find a jeep:  discover an ancient technology.  Can you get it working? Is it a hyper loop tunneling machine?  Or a 4 wheeled Jeep type of vehicle?  But only limited fuel.  Does it have some kind of other capabilities?  A weapon?

Arcane batteries.  If they explode it is like radiation.  Can’t be made anymore.  Can be found out in ancient ruins.  The ancients created them to run much of their technology. Need to find one (like a zero point module from SG1).  Supremely powerful.  Could try to connect one to a beam
Weapon or something.  Could power a rail gun for one shot

A hidden valley where a black market operates.  Like dark web marketplaces, you can buy literally anything.  A largely neutral grouping with some evil characters.  PCs may need to disguise themselves to enter.  Do they go there to buy information?
Where you can buy anything no matter how depraved
Undead whose eyes flow a strange blue.  They move with a strange speed.  +3 dex.
Need to visit a lost library in the Fey wild.  To find knowledge lost in the material plane.
Ruined tomb of an ancient emperor.  Ruled as the god emperor of his empire.  All believed in his divinity and worshipped him.  On death became a lich and now haunts this tomb.

Beneath a cloudless night sky you stand before the towering face of a gigantic glacier.  Speaking an ancient rhyme causes a crack to open up in the face of the glacier, revealing an ice cave leading to the caves of wonder within.
City under the ice:  underneath the great northern ice sheet lies a ruined ancient citadel.  A portal gate connects into it.  Inside frost monsters have made a home.
Defeat a dragon. Its minions believe they must serve whoever slays their master. But they are truly terrible minions. Bad at their duties, very chatty and needy.
Santa Clause inspired:  discover Santa’s dungeon workshop.  Enslaves elves/gnomes to manufacture toys for “kids” around the world.  Has a nefarious reason for giving toys to kids.
Rat-o-mancer.  Like. Necromancer but for rats.  Commands an army of rats.  Perhaps he is a goblin wizard?

Find a magic item charging station.  Like an uber fast charging station.  People standing around waiting for their items to charge, there is a cafe.  Magical items that normally take a long rest/day to recharge recharge in 5 minutes.  Roll 1d4 to see how many charges it adds:
1. It removes any remaining charges
2. It adds half charges
3. It tops up all charges
4. It tops up all charges and adds an extra charge above capacity
A rebel who once attempted to assassinate the king.  he was thrown into an active volcano by order of the king.  he survived
Discover an old imperial vault from an empire long past.  Contains a stash of weapons and potions, including some poisons.

Stone claws.  A circular platform of rock sticks out over a cliff edge, with 5 sharp rock columns stretching up from the edge of it, narrowing to points like claws.  There is a pentagram carved into the floor of the platform.  
When activated the 5 claws draw down lightning into the pentagram which summons a devil, for the purpose of making a demonic bargain.  Inscribed on the ground is a name, surrounded by what appears to be old dried blood.   It is the true name of a devil of the nine hells, which allows this devil to be summoned and bound into service.  The ritual requires a blood sacrifice.  Completing the summoning and binding ritual will bring forth an imp that will serve the PC as its master.  The imp will urge its master to complete acts of evil, in the hope of claiming its masters’ soul. However the imp shows great loyalty to its master and will protect them.

Upon arrival there is two cultists there attempting to summon a devil.  They have called the true name, but have not yet made the blood sacrifice (see a small child bound by the side.  This child is actually chaotic evil - we’re the cultists trying to banish the child to hell?).  They attack.  By killing them you complete the blood sacrifice and complete the binding ritual bringing for an imp familiar, blind to you.

A gnome artificer and her assistant. The artificer looks crazy - wild hair and eyebrows wearing goggles and a white coat.  Has a wagon with big wagon wheels, but clad in gleaming metal, with gull wing doors and “headlights” (lanterns).  Positioned at the top of a steep hill, artificer is fiddling with an arcane engine under the hood.

Assistant is sitting strapped into a single seat in the middle of the wagon.  Also wearing steampunk style goggles, and a puffy vest.  Much younger. 

“Doc” needs some help from PCs to get the arcane engine going.  Need you to hand him the arcane ores being careful not to touch them with your hands.  They go into this thing called a flux capacitor, which converts the ores into power for the arcane batteries.  

While fiddling with the arcane engine, the “alarm” goes off, spouting much green smoke and a voice calls out “I am being burgled.  Please assist with maximum violence.”  Then a green paint bomb explodes, covering the PCs in bright green paint.  It does not cover Doc.  Then a half orc Palladin arrives having heard the alarm and starts to attack the PCs thinking they are robbing Doc.  Won’t be talked down.  Draws sword…

Then when it’s all ready, Doc wants you to help him push the cart with his assistant down the hill.  If asked if the cart has a break or steering wheel the answer is no - and that there is no innovation without risk.  And that the bodies of the young can put up with a lot.  Needs the cart moving to kick start the arcane engine.  Explains needs the cart to reach 88 miles an hour to succeed.

Cart heads down the hill, picking up speed and wobbling quite a bit.  Looks like another wheel might fall off… Doc yells out to assistant “Marty”:  now Marty!  Marty pushes a button and the arcane engine fires pushing the cart forward even faster, continually accelerating.  Sparks begin to fly off the front of the cart, until the whole front is a fireball, then with a BANG!  the cart disappears, leaving a flaming trail from the wheels.

Doc jumps and squeals in celebration.  It worked!!!  Then warns PCs to get out of the way.  10 seconds later the cart comes out of nowhere behind the PCs, and races along before deploying a parachute to stop suddenly.  Marty hops out and compares his pocket watch with Doc.  10 seconds into the future!  They jump around cheering.

If you want, now you could steal an arcane battery…

Also Doc has some gnomish inventions he will offer in exchange for help.  Roll on gnomish contraptions table to see what you get.  One item each.

PCs stumble across a small old wizards tower (20x20 floor space and 7 stories tall).  It has powerful spells protecting from entry, but is filled with interesting magical items, spells, books, sentient creatures, puzzles etc.  the top floor contains the journal of the dead wizard.

Santa's staff he uses to get around the world delivering presents all in one night.  Allows the user to control the passage of time for them and people with them.  The passage of time continues for others.  Cannot go back in time, but can slow time all the way to actually stop time.
Has three charges, recharges each new year.
Can be used as a +2 bowstaff, doing 2d6+6 bludgeoning damage.
This is actually a relic of the Riftborn, and taps into the Time Power Stone.  Uses just a shard of its energy
Magic item:  arcane jet pack.  Uses some of the faun power of antigravity and arcane battery to launch the user up and up and up.  Back pack style appendage with a downward pointing exhaust port

Possible to make a Witcher. Make an elixir from the heart of a monster, your own blood, and some very rare herbs. Drink it and undergo a brutal painful transformation over 24 hours.  Drains your charisma but increases strength dex and wisdom, gain a few basic spells. Like an Eldritch knight but without having to sacrifice a level.
Dwarves brandy is mighty strong stuff.  Firey and hot.
Comets passing in the skies like they did once thousands of years ago, heralding a change coming

There is a hidden pattern to the universe.  Some believe that if you can discover it, you can command reality.  There are cults devoted to scrying the pattern from everyday interactions and the long history of the world, played out in great events.

These boots hold 6 charges.  They regain 1d4+2 charges on a long rest.  You can use a bonus action to expend 3 charges and teleport up to 30 ft to an unoccupied space that you can see.  You can expend any number of additional charges to increase the distance you can teleport by 10ft for each charge you expend.
An inventor who is constantly coming up with strange and bizarre creations.  This time he has invented a bomb that opens a portal to a dark dimension.

In the desert find a temple go Selune (goddess of the moon) with a secret initiation rite chamber where people are made into lycanthropes.  Or a temple of lycanthropy where people are converted
Temple of Selune which is also a temple of lycanthropy.  Lycanthropes gather there in the desert in a rock left hidden
Giant crystals hang in the air and float about randomly.  They seem clouded.  They sometimes seem to flicker with activity inside.

Romani like wandering people. They dress in bright colours and are outwardly a happy go lucky community. They constantly move across the world in tribe like groups and can often be found at city markets selling trinkets, offering repair services, as well as telling stories. They are renowned for their story telling, with a unique take on many classic myths and legends. Strong defenders of their right to travel with a key military strength - not used or even regularly seen, but it is there. Rite of adulthood sends young Veltlani out into the world to learn the ways of other societies, and to train in militaries of the worlds societies. But they are actually the holders of an ancient secret. They remember The Faun and are an ancient order of the protectors of the rifts and the prophecy of the chosen ones. Searching the world forever looking for the chosen ones to support them in their quest. This is why they continue to move across the world, and are so open to interacting with the communities they arrive at - searching for the chosen ones, as per the prophecy. Once they find the chosen ones, they stop wandering, return to their hidden bases and shift focus to be an army of the chosen ones.

An eldritch storm of falling stars.  Delivering starspawn to Faerun.  They are focused on finding the rifts and clearing the way for Elvaxel to come through.  Act as shock troops of The Devoted.  Also claim souls for Elvaxel.

Rumour there was a family of vampire hunters that used great magical weapons and spells to hunt their prey.  Rumour that these weapons and books of spells are hidden in a cache amongst the family mansion, abandoned 500 years ago during a vampire attack.  But the vampires are after the cache too
A helpful NPC always wears a mask to cover their identity.  They appear just at the right moment to get the PCs out of scrapes and provide them with key intelligence.  Who are they really?
The city sewers and storm water canals open out into an open pit surrounded by buildings. A bit like a dirty grimy stinky main square.
The orcs normally are nomadic, but there is an Orc city within a hidden mountain valley

An ancient necrotic item when held makes the holder hear hear the drone of buzzing flies.  The longer you hold it the more intense it sounds.  Then you begin to smell the rotting corpses.  Necessary to be carried and held to complete a quest
Mask of truth - orc ritual hand u the mask when you need to say the truth however unwelcome it is.  No recrimination ex for truths told while wearing the mask.
Nobody who is not a goblin or hobgoblin is allowed in

The vale of shadows.  A valley surrounded by tall mountains that has within a cave a connection to the shadow world.  It is eternally shaded by cloud cover, and flora struggles to live.  Nobody chooses to live here as neutral evil beings from the shadow world are able to and do cross over to the material realm.  A nation of hobgoblins has made the vale of shadows their home base, and even trade with the shadow folk who come through the portal.
A city that was founded as a slave depot

Pass through a mountain pass/canyon and everyone hears in their minds a voice calling to them to do something against their interest.  It knows their names and their secrets.  Fog descends and visibility is decreased.  Out of the corner of your eyes you sense a presence and a being, but when you look directly it is not there.

Names have power.  If you know the true name of a Fey creature or demon or devil you can compel them to do things. Also there is a special sect of magic that allows users to do the same things to the mortal races. It is long forgotten but could be discovered again.
True names have power over beings.  But true names live inside ourselves.  Most are not aware of their true names, it is the name your unconscious mind uses for itself.  To discover it you must undergo a special meditation ceremony, or sacrifice one life to scry the true name of another.  Even inanimate things have a true name.  Like the wind or the water.  Or a rift.  Speaking their names grants the user mastery over them.  But there are levels of mastery.

Angel can be bonded.  At a temple in the wastes, if you make an offering and appropriate commitment to good, they will agree to support you one time if you call.  Perhaps only for a palladin who is committed to a god, they find a temple to their god, ancient and long thought lost.  Some of the ancient rituals have been long forgotten and lost but this sanctum contains the lore and knowledge needed.  Like how to bond with an angel for service.  Turns out you need to say the three oaths (same as the Windrunners in the Stormlight Archive)\
Discover a star portal that allows you to step through into deep space itself. Send and receive messages into the void. In an ancient wizards research base
Strange numbers written all over the walls and roof of a temple.  They are said to have meaning of some sort and carry an ancient secret of power.

Location:  out in the middle of the ocean, a metal trench separates the water.  The water flows over the side into a great drain and past the drain is a long metal band.  This runs around the circumference of the entire world.  Lightning strikes follow around the band continually.  It takes 24 hours to go around the world.

Location:  a civilisation that lives in a city left behind by a forerunner civilisation.  Has a great rift hanging in the air above it and a great gate built to reach it.  Entire city fans out from this point.  Not all of the city has yet been explored or settled - can find remains of the dead forerunners there - looks like they all died at once.  Like living in a necropolis.

Location:  base of what was a space elevator.  Now ruined with the shaft wreckage lying across the world.  In space the orbital platform has sustained damage but remains in orbit, if not exactly circular anymore.  It has sustained damage.

Weapon: Thunderblast. Two handed great sword. On a hit roll a d20. On a 11-15 it deals 4d10 force damage, on a 16-19 it deals 4d10 force damage and pushes the target back 15 feet, on a nat 20 it deals 4d10 force damage and blasts the target apart (instakill)
A city/monastery of the air at the top of a mountain overlooking a giant cliff.  Launch site to travel to a floating city in the clouds - maybe an ancient abandoned floating city.

Location:  geothermal rift monitoring station.  Deep below the earth is a interdimenaional rift.  The sun basements of the monitoring station take you down deeper closer to the rift, while moving higher takes you closer to the mountain peak in which the rift station is based.
Side quest to track down a monster prawn that is attacking honest fishermen and their boats

* Has tunnels and roads running through the trees and along their branches.  The tree has adapted and grown to accept these shapes.  Entire village hidden in the upper boughs of these great trees.
* In a forest like Endor, very tall redwood type trees.

Portal in the top of a giant tree in a deep dark forest. This portal is guarded by the wood elves of the forest as well as the high elves as their greatest secret. It allows users to pass into a parallel dimension that takes them forwards or backwards in time. It is regarded as highly dangerous for individuals but also for the world, and only trained time guardians are allowed to transit the portal, as they follow strict rules not to change the timeline.
Ice monsters that can phase into the snow/ice. They are made of clear ice so very hard to see. Great big ice claws. Big orbs for eyes, that are the only things you can see
Meet a bard in a tavern. He is poor and low powered for magic but very musical. Wants to write ballads of the party - sees them as his ticket to get rich/his next meal. Like Jaskier I the Witcher
The crown of aethel-riad:  a magic item of great power that allows PC to read one persons mind.  But comes with a cost to using it (costs HP?)

Void bomb.  Opens a 10fokt circular portal to the far realm/void.  Lasts for 1 round.  On their turn Target rolls dex save against DC15.  Failure take 4d6 cold damage and an array of tentacle constricts you for a further 2d6 crushing damage.  Target is grappled.  On a save take half cold damage and no crushing damage.  On a 1 target is pulled into the void and the portal disappears.
The sky forge - powered by a rift in the sky, it transfers special properties to any weapons or armory forged here. Must be sought out to create a weapon to defeat Elvaxel
A crazed megalomaniacal wizard is conducting magical genetic experiments to create a perfect monster.  Out in the wilderness, from his lab, one has escaped.
Mushrooms as portals to the feywild.  But the Fey don’t create them.  Who does?

Location:  An island that good folk fear to tread.  Said to be a domain of bones and death. Full of bones and portents.  Sailors say that there are stars to be seen from around near the island that cannot be seen anywhere else and that have not been named.  Actually houses a great rift, but warded so that rift beings cannot leave the island.  The night sky reflects the universe where the rift leads to.
People have folk stories about voidbringers. Talk about an ancient time from before the rift born when waves of eldritch terrors swept across the land.
PCs can discover/buy a giant dress up costume - a big flamingo, or dinosaur, or octopus.

Oaths are sacred to gods and will grant particular powers.  But people have forgotten this.  Oaths are still treated reverentially but without knowledge that using the right words when making an oath and directing it to a particular supernatural entity will bond you to them giving you magical abilities and powers.  Saying more oaths increases the strength of that bond and gives greater powers

Oathgates.  Only able to be accessed by those who have made the sacred mystical oaths. I will protect the weak
Pcs discover the place that makes the purple robes actual robes.  Able to use this to track down their secret headquarters.  And it leads to the devoted.

There is an object or concept that the PCs can’t hear or understand.  Just comes out as mental hashing.  Why?  Someone/thing has removed knowledge of this thing from the world.  The only way to know of it is to be onboarded into the secret society and drink the ichor of remembrance.

Time disturbances. There is a meteorology of time.  Time weather and time storms.  If you can predict them you can partially time travel.  It’s a limited power - can only go where the time storm leads and you need to be able to predict where the right time storm/wormhole will erupt.  Can link time storms to create temporal bombs that will wipe out a time stream.
Be taken to another dimension in a sandy desert under a cold sun in the night sky that casts little light. A giant tree stands alone.
The great oak Bleobheris where the gathering no of the Druid’s allowed all to gather no matter their race or creed
Eldritch incursions that take over a person’s body.  Or mind control.
The Dawnspeak - the language from the early days of the world

Prevailijg wisdom is that the Forerunners left and took all their magic and beneficial power with them, casting Taeleran into a dark age for thousands of years. And when they left they destroyed the world, upheaving the landscape and radically altering the world. In fact they were killed, and their death released a wave of magical power that created havoc
There is a prophecy about the Twilight Princess, said to play a crucial role in The Prophecy.  And Elara is the Twilight Princess.
A dwarf city that sits on the surface of a mountain - above the clouds (and only above the clouds) this dwarven city is open to the air (as well as delving deep within the mountain).

column2: The Lady of the Lake and the Witch of the Waterfall
column3: The lady of the lake is pretty chill. Her cousin, the Witch of the Waterfall is not. She is rude and suspicious and doesn’t like people. But she is not evil
An order of lawful neutral witches who influence politics by acting as advisers.  They seek to bring forth The Chosen by carefully mixing bloodlines.  The Bene Gesserit.

The town of Taylors Gap. On either side of a great ravine, famous as the only crossing of the White River for 20 miles either way. It has an old bridge for people only and a cargo zip line for heavy goods and horses and vehicles

There is a prophecy of the chosen ones who may have the chance to return our world to the glory days of the Forerunners. The chosen ones will face great trials and almost lose, lose the entire world. They will face trials and betrayals, but may have the opportunity to bring all into the light of happiness and justice
Dwarven casinos - like American Indian casinos

A section of the world where only barbarian tribes live.  They are very connected to the land.  There is a secret power from the land that they protect.  It gives them great magical powers but they pretend they don’t have the magic.  In fact using the magic in public is taboo.  Secretly more powerful than they let on (like Wakanda).
A city state where magic use is banned. Innate magic users (sorcerers) are executed. Spell breakers are hunters of sorcerers
Unicorn troops.  Unicorn cavalry.  Undead unicorn cavalry shock troops?
Goblins as scrappy little rat men who like shinies.  Not necessarily evil, just selfish

column2: There's always money in the banana stand
column3: Have a banana stand full of cash. And a scenario to burn it down. It is the only place to buy bananas in Neverwinter. The fruit merchants guild have a monopoly on bananas. The guild of vegetable merchants are jealous of this banana monopoly and hire the PCs to burn down the banana stand.

Across the sea there is a land with an orc empire.  A settled civilization. The orcs on the main continent were exiled from this civilization and have no relation to this new land so roam looking for a home, clashing with towns and villages when they find them, so they can survive by raiding.  For they have no honor and thus must be raiders (for warriors are the lowest level of the orc society).  
The orcs live in the desert wastes and the unoccupied grasslands.  Different tribes in different areas, with different skin colors.  Green skin orcs in grasslands, red skin or “fire skin” orcs in the desert.  Nomadic raiders.  Said to be some whiteskin orcs in the frozen north.

column2: Forerunner ruins have a bad rep
column3: Investigating the Riftborn ruins and knowledge comes with a cost.  It depletes your memory?  Null field?  Slowly reduces your max hp, sapping your vitality.  For all but the Chosen who have the blood of the Riftborn and can end the curse.  It is a curse put upon the Riftborn by the Devoted?
Something is always said to be watching, watching from a place in the sky.  Sometimes it sends shooting stars down to earth which decimate the landing area.  Is it an ancient orbital platform?
The Silver Brand outlaws.  A famous smuggling ring and pirate band.

The Coin. A merchants guild. They always have very special things that are rare and difficult to get. If you need a special item you can ask The Coin. But they are very very expensive. They also trade in favors. can call in a favor. Coin for power.

Buffy the vampire slayer ripoff
A hellmouth has opened near a town.  It is birthing monsters from the abyss.  A watcher (like Giles) has tracked it down and provides the PCs with info on the latest creature and how to end it.

column2: The god of dad jokes and trivia

column3: On entering the rift site, PCs hear all sound stop. Hear eldritch whispering and the call of the rift. Everyone else has stopped frozen in time. They hear Azathoth whisper something to them - a message. Then time restarts and sound comes back.

Amazonians do parcel delivery.  Some “porch pirates” keep stealing the packages.  PCS are hired to investigate.  It’s a whole goblin “pirate” gang stealing and reselling the packages, as a front in the Amazon retail network - as a vendor unknown to the Amazons.  The Amazons are the supply chain to the goblin pirate organization.  They track orders and go steal the things they need.  In fact they steal the things people order from them as they only have limited stock so they recycle the stock and resell it:

The Amazons use a big smile on their delivery packages.  They are a popular delivery service because of their brawn, able to defend vs bandits out in the wild.

column2: Dark energy and dark matter storage facilities
column3: Dark energy and dark matter storage facilities.  The Riftborn were collecting dark energy in order to weaponise it against Azathoth.
Consuming it can create a state like a barbarian's rage

Come upon a kingdom that is supposed to be friendly.  But it is not friendly..  turns out someone is controlling the king - grima wormtongue style.  Classic King Theoden.  PCs need to cast Grima out and remove the charm on the king.  King wakes up and is angry at what has happened - his own son has died, his lands have been invaded.  But now King Theoden owes a great debt to the PCs.

column2: A grumpy but helpful old witch
column3: Modelled on Granny Weatherwax from Discworld books.  has strong opinions e.g. Demons ought to come when they are called.  All this invocations is pandering to them, is all, making them feel important.  They’ll get airs and graces if we’re not careful
Eldritch black tar that takes over corpses and animates them as thralls.
Armour of Alcohol. You drink a bottle of whiskey and you don’t feel any psychic damage because you sit ubderstand it. You become poisoned.

column2: Song:  A Wizard's Staff has a knob on its end
column3:
Verse 1:
Oh, a wizard needs his staff, don’t you know it’s true,
For casting mighty spells, and stirring up the brew,
Impressing fair young maidens, middle-aged women too,
Even older ladies find its power quite true!
Chorus:
A wizard’s staff has a knob on the end,
It’s big and round and long, my friend,
With a swish and a flick, it makes the magic bend,
A wizard’s staff has a knob on the end!
Verse 2:
In the darkest of caves or the highest of towers,
The staff stands firm, showing off its powers,
But to keep it strong, you’ve got to treat it right,
Rub it vigorously, massage it every night!
Chorus:
A wizard’s staff has a knob on the end,
It’s big and round and long, my friend,
With a swish and a flick, it makes the magic bend,
A wizard’s staff has a knob on the end!
Bridge:
It feels so good when others lay hands,
On your sturdy staff, as it travels across the lands,
But remember this truth, as it always returns,
To the hands it trusts, where the magic burns!
Verse 3:
From the depths of the forest to the bustling inn,
The staff’s always handy, causing quite a din,
With special oils, and a loving touch,
A wizard’s staff stays powerful, thank you very much!
Chorus:
A wizard’s staff has a knob on the end,
It’s big and round and long, my friend,
With a swish and a flick, it makes the magic bend,
A wizard’s staff has a knob on the end!
Outro:
So raise a glass high, and sing it loud and proud,
A wizard’s staff is the best around,
In the right hands, it erupts with great might,
A wizard’s staff has a knob, shining bright!

column2: Illegal alley gambling game for the rogue and bard
The power of song and story to motivate the population to support an idea or revolution.

column3: The second moon is an inactive Riftborn weapon. And houses one of the power stones
Ascension.  Is there a belief that the Riftborn ascended?
A rare and valuable mineral that can store magic charges.  Critical in the crafting of many magic items

The Guild has guild houses in most large towns across Taeleran, having spread over the past millennia (it is a very old organisation).  The guild has significant commercial interests across the myriad civilisations  ranging from performing contract work for others (from recovery of lost property, persons, to acting as hired muscle/protection, and even as a milita for hire if you have enough coin).  The Guild also has ownership interests in most of the large commercial organizations of Taeleran.  However the main focus of activity for the Guild is completing internal contracts to discover and recover treasures from the wilds of the land, and make more of the wild lands known, understood, safe and most importantly controlled.
The guild is held in high regard as an honourable organisation.  They help to keep the wheels of commerce turning across the land, and often support the governments of the lands, performing services on a contract basis, so the rulers of most places are keen to have the adventurers guild working in their lands.  In these poor times you feel lucky to have the opportunity to work for them.  Plus the coin is good.
The Adventurers Guild’s stated purpose is to discover and retrieve the treasures from the uncharted wilds and ruins of the far away lost lands, bringing fresh wealth to the civilisations of the land and keeping the wheels of commerce turning.

The Order of the Ashard is a prestigious and ancient organization of skyborne knights who patrol the skies astride majestic flying mounts. These knights are renowned for their unwavering sense of justice, their mastery of aerial combat, and their commitment to protecting the realms below from airborne and terrestrial threats alike.
The order takes its name from Ashard, a good ancient dragon said to have forged a pact with the first knights to ensure the safety of the skies. Legend holds that Ashard gifted the knights with knowledge of taming and bonding with flying mounts, before vanishing into the heavens.
The order was established during a time of chaos when sky raiders and dragon cults terrorized the lands. Since that time, finding mounts has become increasingly difficult, as has recruitment - who wants to put themselves at risk for people they don’t know?  Self interest has increased and has made recruitment difficult.  As a result, the order is a smaller force than it once was, and has retracted its area of operations to the immediate region surrounding their fortress..
Tenets of the Order
* The knights of the Ashard adhere to a strict code of conduct, summarized in the Five Winds:
* The Wind Protects: Defend the innocent from harm, no matter the cost.
* The Wind Guides: Lead by example, showing wisdom and humility in all actions.
* The Wind Strikes: Deliver swift justice to those who threaten peace.
* The Wind Endures: Hold firm against adversity, as the sky holds firm against the storm.
* The Wind Unites: Work as one with allies, mounts, and the forces of nature.
The Order of the Ashard is forgotten by most, and they can only field a force large enough to protect the immediate area around their fortress.  Where they have a presence though they serve as protectors of the skies, patrolling trade routes, battling airborne threats, and intervening in disputes where justice is at stake.  They remain neutral in political affairs unless innocents are directly endangered.

Holy Overbite grew up in Sweetmeadow, a town steeped in sugar and decay, with a father (Denton Overbite) obsessed with climbing the corporate ladder at the local candy factory and a mother (Eloise) whose life was consumed by poor health caused by an all-candy diet. Desperate to save his mother, Holy turned to self-taught dentistry, practicing on stray dogs and unintentionally giving them unsettlingly perfect smiles, which led to his exile from the town. After his mother’s death and driven by guilt and a vision of purity, Holy found purpose through Molarmo, the eldritch Patron of Smiles, vowing to combat dental neglect and decay wherever he went. Now, he roams the land as a zealous healer, armed with magical tools and an unrelenting obsession to bring perfect smiles to all—even as  he uncovers a darker truth: his estranged father has become a key figure in a shadowy faction profiting from the very decay Holy seeks to destroy.  Molarmo seeks teeth for an unknowable reason, and is in fact the boss of the Tooth Fairy, an actual fairy, who is a warlock just like Holy

Percy is a dwarf paladin who serves Bahamut, god of order and good dragons.  Bahamut is all but forgotten with the absence of good dragons in the world.  However, Percy found an amulet amongst the possessions of this mother long after she died, that revealed that she was in fact a high cleric of Bahamut, part of a small order who continued to workshop and serve bahamut.
